name: Cloth Folding and Sorting
description: A multi-ending world about folding and sorting laundry with different approaches and outcomes

states.description: Large pile of clean laundry dumped on bed - mixed clothes, towels, and linens all jumbled together
Clothes carefully sorted into neat piles by category - shirts, pants, towels, linens each in separate stacks
Grabbed random items from pile and started folding without sorting - mixed categories scattered around
Methodically folding each category using proper techniques - crisp folds, uniform stack heights
Haphazardly folding items in random order - some folded neatly, others crumpled, losing track of what's done
All items folded beautifully - stacks organized by type, ready to be put away in drawers
Frustrated with tedious folding - some items tossed in wrinkled balls, debating whether to continue
Mixed results - some items folded acceptably, others barely folded, piles starting to tip over
Gave up on folding properly - just making rough rectangles and stacking loosely
Perfect completion: All laundry folded using Marie Kondo method, organized by category, stacked vertically in drawers for easy visibility
Well organized: All laundry folded neatly, sorted by type, stacks are stable and tidy in closet
Acceptable finish: Laundry mostly folded, some wrinkles remain, stacks are uneven but functional
Gave up frustrated: Half-folded pile abandoned on bed, many items still wrinkled and unfolded
Stuffed drawers: Gave up folding, just crammed everything into drawers - clothes compressed and wrinkled
Stack collapse: Poorly stacked piles toppled over when moving them, clothes scattered across floor requiring re-folding

actions.description: Sort all clothes carefully by category before folding - shirts, pants, towels, linens
Skip sorting step and start folding items randomly from the pile
Fold each category methodically using proper folding techniques, taking time to make crisp folds
Fold items randomly without system, using inconsistent techniques
Continue folding carefully maintaining high quality standards throughout
Get frustrated with tedious folding task, quality starts to decline
Finish with Marie Kondo vertical folding method, organize perfectly in drawers
Complete folding competently, stack neatly in closet
Give up in frustration, leave half-folded pile on bed
Rush through remaining items just to finish, quality suffers
Give up folding, just stuff remaining clothes into drawers unfolded
Stack items sloppily without care for stability
Fold quickly but acceptably, prioritize speed over perfection
Try to move unstable stacks to closet
